isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS - EXTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR BOTH MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCHES

svcproc.title: EXTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR BOTH MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCHES

step1.para:
Depress the clutch pedal in the cab and measure clutch brake setting. Refer to INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCH WITH CLUTCH BRAKE
With proper release travel and free travel settings, clutch brake squeeze should occur approximately 1" from the end of the pedal stroke ( Figure 56). To check this:

step2.para: Insert a .010" feeler gauge or a standard business card between the release bearing and the clutch brake.
Depress the clutch pedal and squeeze the business card.
Let the pedal up slowly until the card can be pulled out (the pedal should be 1/2" to 1" from the end of the pedal stroke).

step1.para: To shorten or lengthen the external linkage, refer to GROUP 11 - LINKAGE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct procedure and specifications for the vehicle being serviced. If proper adjustment cannot be obtained, inspect linkage for excessive wear.
